body.raw:
{
    "module": "LAK3201",
    "ay": "21/22",
    "semester": "Sem 1",
    "description": "This is one of the most meaningful modules I have taken in my university life. Take this module if you are interested in a deeper appreciation of Kpop or anything Korean. For me, it was was really rewarding to learn the language and simultaneously have a deeper appreciation of Kpop lyrics, instead of just listening to them blindly. For example, I did not know that some of BTS's lyrics were so motivating until I actually understood them. I definitely will try Korean 4 next semester.",
    "expected": "B+",
    "grade": "B",
    "rating": "3",
    "submitter": "ilovechocolate"
}

{
    "module": "LSM1301",
    "ay": "15/16",
    "semester": "Sem 1",
    "description": "Another easy A module. Sec 4 biology. Just be familiar with the lecture powerpoint notes. One or two days to study it is enough. There are 6 labs which are all very doable. Don't forget your lab coat kids. Go for the lectures. The first part especially; they bring live samples and it's super interesting. Only gripe is climbing up the hill to reach LT32.",
    "expected": "A",
    "grade": "A",
    "rating": "5",
    "submitter": "Chng Xinni"
}

{
    "module": "CS4226",
    "ay": "21/22",
    "semester": "Sem 1",
    "description": "If you want to take a rly light mod, this is it. A bit of math and probability at the start, so if you rly cmi probability then you might wanna take note of that (It's only important for like 1-2 topics though). Curve is pretty steep I believe. Content wise, if you are interested in knowing models for queuing and resource allocation in networks, you will find this interesting, but overall I don't think I learnt much from this module. Biggest takeaway was SDN (and the principles and motivations for it).",
    "expected": "B+",
    "grade": "A",
    "rating": "2",
    "submitter": "Saad Haider"
}
